Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: papaphilya
Reviews.Content: First of all, when you buy anything, you assume that the cheaper the item, the lower the quality. This is not the case. I bought the 39" version and could not be happier. just a heads up, i bought this TV to use for my computer and xbox360 only.Pros:-Very slick design-Amazing 1080p, watching blu-ray movies is a treat, everything is clear-Extremely cheap for the specs, will no find another TV for same price with same specs.Cons:-Sound sucks. But hey! it's a television! made for viewing, not listening.-Stand does not spin and is made of glass.. yikes, careful not to break it. However it looks really nice.-Not too many picture adjustable options!!!!!!INFORMATIVE FACTS!!!!!!!!!!-In case you didnt do your research and is skeptical about buying this TV, it is a chinese manufacturer, that uses SAMSUNG screens in their TVs. The reason they are so cheap, is because they have a really good screen and no super duper features. If you need something to display movies and such, this is perfect.-If you are going to use this TV as a monitor, BUY IT!, People are not aware that if they try to buy a 120hz tv, it will be useless with their computer, as computers output at 60hz. In fact, a 120hz is actually lagging with a PC. Personally, if you ask me, watching a movie with 120hz just looks weird. It is only useful if watching sports. This TV gives the best movie experience.-I fixed the lame sound quality by purchasing logitech LS21 speakers 2.1. I gotta say, that it sounds absolutely amazing. Unless you are one of those weirdos that listens specifically to get some crazy ass sound, get those speakers and plug em in. Problem solved. No need to spend $$$$ on a home theater system.XBOX!:For some reason my games looked pretty bad when i started playing them. Heads up!: adjust the sharpness of the TV to about 25% so it's is not as sharp. The best auto setting to be on is "cinematic" if you do not like fiddling with the TV.PC!: for me, I am using a HDMI to DVI cable from my graphics card but for some reason it doesnt auto detect the TV on boot. (on ATI graphics cards). EDIT: just found the solution. Set your graphics card software to scan for TVs on startup.Overall: This is a pretty awesome TV, especially for the price.UPDATE: 1/9/2013: TV is still amazing. Playing games on the 360 is still awesome. I got greedy and bought z-5500 speakers from craigslist and a coax digital cable. I now have a massive home theater with about $1000 off of what it would cost me originally. *drool*Update: 4/1/2013: Sold this thing in perfect working condition and bought the 55" version.

Reviews.Title: An okay HDTV
Reviews.Author: Tomboy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TCL brand LE39FHDF3300TA television one week ago and listed below is a brief summary of my observations to date.- The screen does not have anti-glare treatment so room lights are annoyingly visible while watching TV.- Off axis viewing is not good. There is obvious color and contrast shift when viewing the screen off center.- Digital audio output uses S/PDIF coaxial cable connection. This might necessitate purchasing a converter if you require TOSLINK fiber-optic or analog lineout connections.- Digital audio settings are provided for Dolby, PCM, or off. This should accommodate most home theater or stereo systems.- Poor sound quality using the internal TV speakers, equalization adjustment has little effect on the sound.- There are no analog audio outputs other than headphones.- TV dissipates very little heat, uses LED backlighting.- When installed into a cabinet the edge of the screen could be obscured by the cabinet depending on cabinet size. The screen sits back 3 inches from the front edge of the TV stand.- Easy to setup and use, light weight.- Low price when compared to other brands.- Two year warranty is longer than most assuming service is available when needed.TCL LE39FHDF3300TA 39-Inches 1080p LED HDTV with 2-Year Limited Warranty - Black

Reviews.Title: TCL 32" LED
Reviews.Author: SRN
Reviews.Content: Just recieved this tv today and I'm very impressed with the picture quality. I was very skeptical of buying a TV of a name I've never heard but this is a nice tv. I do wish the base was not made of glass but I had no issues putting it together.***EDIT!!*** Do not buy this crappy TV! Four months and now it will not turn on. Called warranty number and I now have to ship from GA to CA at my own expense.

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV - UPS delivered in 3 days!
Reviews.Author: SeBo "seb6000"
Reviews.Content: I ordered it late Friday afternoon and not including the Monday holiday I received the item on Tuesday (so 2-3 business days). The UPS delivered item was not damaged in any way, nor were its internal contents (as I read in some reviews for TCL Tvs).My HDTV is the TCL 39" (3300) model which sold for $329 compared to $418 for the 43" TCL model. I didn't think a couple more inches were worth so much more in cost. I do need to say that Amazon was selling the TCL 42" model for $369, (but they ran out of stock just before I ordered, so maybe that sale will return, it's the best deal).My previous HDTV was a 32" RCA (720p with 5000:1 contrast) that I got at Walmart for $899 five years ago, but it died so I wanted a cheap replacement and this one was the one I chose. The setup on the TCL tv was easy, just put  the bottom glass stand on with 4 screws, connect a couple cables and turn on the TV. It goes through a quick channel scan and that's it. The picture is quite an upgrade from my previous RCA HDTV, plus its a much larger screen size. My old RCA had problems getter all the local broadcast (free to air) HD channels, but this thing is picking up all of them from as far away as 90 miles WOW!The sound quality to me seems NORMAL for a TV of this price. My TCL model doesn't sound thin or tinnie, nor does the TCL volume go extremely loud. But there are 2 audio output options, to resource the sound out to other locations by using either the headphone jack, or the SPDIF connections (SPDIF is a type of digital audio interconnect cable)(S/PDIF: check it on Wiki for more info). So if you want high quality digital output, you have to use these 2 options.Remember the thinner TVs get, the thinner their speakers become, and this reduces their sound quality. So think about adding a cheap sound-bar (with or without a sub-woofer) to your TV, this works really well to improve your sound at a minimal cost. I'm thinking of adding a sound-bar with a wireless sub-woofer that also has built-in Bluetooth (like the LG NB3520A model). This sound-bar can also be used for my wireless tablets and phones to stream media to wirelessly, by way of its built-in Bluetooth. Another cheap one: iLive ITB382B Bluetooth Sound Bar with AM/FM Radio - both of these soundbars are available at Amazon.comThe remote isn't perfect, they really don't use the 4 arrows on it properly, but it does have a couple of extra features that are nice like a channel info button and channel guide button, so you can see what programs are coming up.There's a large orange power light in the bottom right corner that can be annoying at night in a bedroom, but I just put a piece of black electrical tape over it.The 39" screen is a perfect size for the bedroom or living room, its 1080p,  100,000:1 contrast ratio is beautiful and the 1/2" trimmed edge only compares to the newer, more expensive, HD models coming out now. This Tv's thickness and weight is good for tv stands, tables, and in some cases wall mounting, but most people might want to goes with a thinner model for wall mounting. It is an LED tv so its weight is on the lighter side.Yes this TV's cost is cheaper than most and you only get 2 HDMI inputs, but the performance, screen size, beauty, picture quality, and lack of problems, make this TV well worth its price. The Energy Guide rating is $11, so it uses very little power.Generally its hard to get 5 star reviews from me, and maybe I will come back later and edit it if I have problems, but so far its what I review it to be. A person cannot expect the world for $300 plus dollars, but for me its a KEEPER!

Reviews.Title: The New Vizio
Reviews.Author: Pocono Bob
Reviews.Content: When I began to buy flat panel TV's several years ago, the prices were still pretty high.  I researched & researched.  I came upon the Vizio line & my 1st purchase was a 50" 1st generation plasma.  I was very happy w/ the set, so my next purchase was another Vizio.  A few years had passed and technology advanced some more & I ended up getting a 42" LCD and to this day the picture is great especially for a 2nd set in our dining room.  The picture was/is better than the original plasma.  I found Vizio to be a great bang for the buck at the time & pretty much still think the same.OK, onto the TCL.  I wanted another TV for our bedroom.  I researched and stumbled on the TCL brand which I'd never heard of before.  I read every review on every TCL TV I saw that was remotely interested in.  I found that it's a Co from China.  I also read that the actual screens are Samsung.  I didn't need anything special for our bedroom since TV viewing is minimal.  I wasn't looking for a TV w/ all the bells & whistles by any strech.  From day 1 of researching flat panel's I was amazed at how many didn't include a timing system.  I mean there's a clock, so how difficult could it be - right?  It's a digital world now!  Well, I still find many TV's these days that don't so you can imagine my surprise when setting up this 39" TCL last night and seeing that there were settings for not only the clock, (w/ a simple to use)sleep timer, but also Power On settings as well.  I was thrilled especially being that this purchase was to be for the bedroom.  Sleep timer - Off, and Pwer - On when it's time to get up.  Simple concept I know, but very much appreciated.The packaging was in very good condition and the TV arrived undamaged & very timely.  When I unpacked the content the very 1st thing I did was connect an HDMI cable from my satellite provider, and plug the power up.  I never even cared about putting it on the stand, b/c I read the negative reviews about this TV not even powering up, or upon intial power up, that was it.  I was pleased to see it functioned normally, disconnected the cabling and proceeded to the install of the stand.  Pretty simple.Set up took only a few brief minutes to get familiar w/ navigating & locating all of the settings.I changed channels a many times to compare the quality of the picture and set up the "Picture setting" to my liking.  The sound isn't the best, but not many TV's these days are.  That's what external systems are for and mine was already in place so one more cable connection & I was finished w/ this installation after I programmed the remote, which took no time.I find that the picture & ease of use of this TCL is like the Vizio of old, "the best bang for your buck!!!"  I would defintley give another TCL a try in the future especially w/ it's competetive price and what you get for it.  Keeping in mind it's only 24 hours old, but I couldn't be more pleased w/ this purchase.  I'll ammend this accordingly if need be after some time has passed, but upon my initial eval, I'm a a happy camper.I'll go as far as to date myself.  I am techical in nature 1st of all, but, I've witnessed the advent of the TV/technical advance from B & W to color consoles, to the bulky & heavy table top CRT's requiring a 2 man lift. Then onto the projection flat screens housed in a huge package.  Plasma, LCD & LED true flat panel TV's.  So I've seen them all & love the advancement of technology.  Not very long ago when researching a TV (in the middle of the pack) I found pretty much the cost to be approx $10/".  That would put this set @ approx $400.  Well, enough said there!I would recommend this to anyone of my friends/family.

Reviews.Title: Warranty?  Hardly.
Reviews.Author: Cap'n Jan "Cap'n Jan"
Reviews.Content: Update:  2012-12-09:  We got the TV back.  Rather we got A TV back.  It isn't the model we had, it is the 'replacement' model, newer, and it is not compatible with the laptop we use for it.  However.  It is back, apparently they read the review ;->  I must say that the picture on the replacement is very crisp.  No dead pixels out of the box, but we will see how long it lasts.  I WILL update the review if we have further problems.My original review stands.  Four months is too long to wait for service on a warranted consumer product.  If they weren't going to fix the original it should have, at the very least, been replaced within the month.  Ludicrous.  Perhaps they noticed the flurry of one star reviews...Update:  It is November 7, 2012:  Our TV has been at the 'repair shop' (warehouse?  Garbage dump?) now since the first of August 6, 2012.  That makes it 3 months.In talking to my husband last night he said "I bet the reason these TV's are so inexpensive is they bought up all the discontinued parts sitting around in China, assembled the TV's and sold them dirt cheap."  So what if they break?  They are disposable!  Trouble is they don't inform the customers that they are throw-aways.  Instead they talk about their warranty!  And their Customer Service!!!.  The disposable TV theory makes sense to me particularly given the treatment we have gotten.  I am putting this review on EVERY TCL TV even though we only bought the 42 inch version.In looking at other reviews (and not just on Amazon) TCL has this same ho-hum attitude about customer service for ALL of their TV's.  I promise to eat crow if we ever see that TV again, but I don't think I'll be burping feathers any time soon.  I would bet money we will never see that TV again.  I'd appreciate any comments where people have had satisfactory customer service - it might restore my faith that I will see that TV on the front porch in the next couple of years.----------------------------------My original review written in October still stands:When we set it up, we were very happy with the picture quality, there were a few dead pixels, but that doesn't show up much and we weren't concerned. But the whole panel died after only 6 months. We aren't big TV watchers either. The thing was on less than 5 hours a week.So we contacted TCL (after several tries to get them on the phone), they gave us the number of the repair shop we were to send this TV to. After several tries, I got them on the phone. They agreed to send us a box to ship it in (a whole other fiasco, but that's not to do with the TV).We received the packing box (after a couple of weeks). We packed it and sent it to them Fed-Ex the same day.Now the Big Wait begins. After 3 weeks I called (again, several times, for several days before an answer). Oh, its here, it is in our shop and they are working on it. Sometimes it takes a couple of weeks because we are So Busy!!OK. Fine. We wait some more. Three more weeks. I call (yes, again, several times over a period of days before I get an answer). NOW there is a problem getting the part. But it should be in 'any time now'.Hmmm. So I wait some more. Another 3 weeks. I call (here we go again! several times a day, for several days -FINALLY an answer). This time someone let the cat out of the bag and told me that the 'panel' that my TV needs is on 'back order'. They have a warehouse full of TCL TV's waiting for this part. She was honest enough to say that it could be 3 months or 3 years before it is received. They simply do not know.Of course it is not the repair shop's fault. I am mad at them for not being more forthcoming, but it is TCL's fault for not providing proper warranty service - TCL simply does not care about customer service.I will update this review as things change, but things probably won't change. This week I am due to call again. I am nothing if not persistent.So, you can go ahead and buy a TCL TV, and you might get lucky and get one that works for a while. But then you can send it to the repair shop so it can keep mine company - in the 'warehouse full of TCL TV's needing repair'.Fair Winds,Cap'n Jan

Reviews.Title: A Beautiful TV for a Budget Price
Reviews.Author: Alksion
Reviews.Content: I've owned 3 TV's in the past 5 years, this one is by far the best investment I've made for the price, I have a 47" LG and a 32" Sharp and now this 39" TCL....If you can get past the fact that it is a brand that you have never heard of then you will love it. I ordered this TV because I live (have a roommate) from China that is here to study. I asked him a lot about TCL and he said that it is very popular in China and a very good and trusted brand with good warrantees, he actually owns one in his house back in Beijing. Everything he explained to me made complete sense so I ended up purchasing it and wasn't disappointed, I was actually thrilled by it. I know a lot of people on here complain about thing but you can't please everyone right? Even the $5,000 Sharp TV's have reviews of people who weren't happy, common guys, electronics don't always work perfectly or satisfy everyone because we all know no matter what the brand, LG, Sony, Sharp, or TCL....electronics can fail and have problems but this comes with a 2 year warranty for free which is more then I got for my other TV's and I had to pay $200+ for them so this is really a sweet deal.Pros:- Stunning Visuals when picture is changed to "Cinema" and sharpness is reduced between 25-50,- Small bevel around the sides makes it look like an expensive TV- Picture quality is just as good as my $1,399 LG- It's relatively thin and has a very nice glas mount bottom, a very attractive TV to say the least- Piano black finish looks great in any room or entertainment system- 39 inches is just big enough for a room and gives a great picture without taking up too much room- Dirt Cheap TV with the quality of a $1,000 TV, what else are you looking for?Cons:-When the screen is all black you can see some light leakage on the sides but it doesn't affect the movie or game- The sound isn't that great but I fixed that by plugging in $30 Logitech speakers from Target and it sounds awesome now- Only has 2 HDMI ports, so if you have a lot of things to plug into it, like in a living room this may not be the TV you are looking for.- There really aren't any cons beyond that, everything about this TV blows me away for what I payed for it.Realize this, if you are a TV guru, this isn't he TV for you, go buy a $25,000 85" Sony 4k screen. But if you're just your average joe or someone who appreciates great picture quality but either don't have a budget for a more expensive TV or you're just trying not to spend a lot of money, this is the TV for you.

Reviews.Title: Best TV We've owned
Reviews.Author: Joyce Miletic "+"
Reviews.Content: Daily I hear my husband say how incredibly clear and detailed the picture is. When first turned on, the screen was too dark; we easily found and adjusted the settings and now the picture is crystal clear. The volume is good as well. It readily hooked up with TiVo and did not require an extra box for cable connection. It has an earphone outlet in the side back. We are happy about that, as that is fairly important to us, when one wants to sleep and the other wants to watch TV. It is a little inconvenient to reach around to the back to insert the jack, though it is on the side_ish, so not as bad as all the way in the back. Over all this is the best TV we have owned so far and it is priced so low!

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: remy02
Reviews.Content: Purchased product on 11/21/11, loved it, great image, however it died onn 9/14/12.  Today it is 11/2/12 and after calling, emailing or live texting everyday and getting a different answer from customer service from Westinghouse Digital I was told my unit could not be repaired.  I was told it would be 10-12 weeks for a replacement or I could request a refund which would take the same amount of time.  I have read many review, this seems to happen to MANY of the customer who bought the same product.  You get what you pay for, spend the right amount of money for a product that will last and for a manufacturer who will stand behind their product.  I will never be cheap again!

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this TV
Reviews.Author: ujjugh
Reviews.Content: Has got the TV just few months now .. Bought during black friday 2012 .. Hardly used it as it was a bedroom TV .. found yesterday that it stopped working .. the power button goes on .. and thats it .. nothing happens ..Tried the support number in website .. something says number does not exists .. other times just rings ... tried to use the contact form in there website (submits with error) .. finally emailed them .. but looking into the other updates related to warranty not too hopeful ..WILL KEEP POSTED IF THE MY EXPERIENCE WITH THE CUSTOMER SERVICE IS BETTER ...

Reviews.Title: Good quality and great value
Reviews.Author: happy_camper
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptical given the price and relatively unknown "TCL" brand, but another user review mentioned TCL uses Samsung displays, so I did some research. I couldn't confirm that, but I did find that Samsung and TCL formed a partnership where each owns a 10%-15% stake in the other's production facilities, and that TCL manufacturers 2.55 million LCD displays for use in Samsung TVs each year. That gave me some comfort in TCL's quality, so I took the chance knowing I had Amazon's return policy as a safety net.Packaging:Fairly standard, though the glass stand was not secured properly and came loose during shipping, partially ripping the plastic wrap around the TV. Thankfully, there was no damage.Build quality:The glass stand is heavy (perhaps half as heavy as the TV itself) and supportive with rubber feet on the underside. It does not slide, even on inclines, and the TV does not sway or wobble - it would be difficult to accidentally knock it over. The plastic around the TV itself is solid and does not seem likely to break without being hit or dropped. However, while it seems sturdy around the edges, the plastic does bow around the VESA mount in the back when pressed on - though it does not seem to compromise the strength/integrity of the TV.Picture quality:Out of the box, the picture quality was just 'ok' - colors were too bright/washed out and everything seemed pixelated. After I switched display modes to 'cinematic' and lowered the sharpness, along with some other tweaks, I upgraded my opinion of the picture to be 'very good.' Imagery is natural-looking with great white/black contrast, and fast-motion video (such as action movies and NASCAR) is smooth without pixelation or streaking (despite the 60Hz refresh rate). Plus, I have found no dead pixels, no backlighting leaks, and no significant image distortion when viewing at very wide angles around the room. Nevertheless, strong lighting contrasts within small regions (such as in dimly-lit scenes of horror movies) appear somewhat washed-out. And I would have preferred a matte display as this one is glossy seemingly without an anti-glare coating, so bright lights in the room can cause a distracting glare at certain angles. Still, these caveats are relatively minor and are to be expected in this price range.Sound quality:I was quite surprised how good and strong the sound was out of the box. I purchased this set fully expecting to pick up a sound system as well based on other reviews, but the downward-facing built-in speakers are loud and rich enough that I'm not going to. Thus far, I haven't had the need to turn it up above 40% in an average-sized living room to get an immersive experience. The only issue I've encountered is with the simulated surround sound feature - there is a very noticeable vibration/reverberation during louder scenes, so I disabled it in the settings and haven't had a problem since.Features:I'm running everything through a new Google TV box, so its USB audio/image (sorry, no video) playing abilities, channel labeling, sleep timer, etc. are of little concern to me. However, it does have the standard manual picture (brightness/contrast/sharpness/backlight/color/tint/temperature) and sound (equalizer/balance) settings. In addition, it offers auto-volume leveling (based on the content), dynamic backlighting (based on content), and a dynamic light sensor (based on room lighting). I was surprised to find the TV had the latter since the model comparison chart here on Amazon said it didn't have that feature - but it does (sensor is in the lower left corner) and it seems to work well! Volume is steady and backlight transitions are very smooth.Remote:The included remote is light, easy to use, and offers good range, though I use the universal remote from my Google TV instead. I know others have had issues using their cable/satellite remotes to adjust the TV, but the Google TV remote easily controls power on/off, volume, and mute, which are the only native TV controls I need most of the time. For settings and input change, I still revert back to the included remote.Warranty:TCL's 2-year warranty is longer than any competitor's, and does offer the possibility of in-home service (at their discretion). Unfortunately, they only pay the cost of shipping back from the repair facility, not to it, if they elect not to do in-home repair, which seems to be the industry standard. Thankfully, a SquareTrade warranty covers all shipping costs in addition to extending the coverage term. ~$10/yr is reasonable to enhance the default warranty and ensure the TV's longevity, though hopefully I never have to use either.Other:- The ultra-slim bezel looks great, as does the glass stand, both of which are nice selling points. It's hard to tell from the product photos, but the glass stand actually has a black coating on the bottom, so only the outer 1/4" is transparent, which looks quite good.- This model is more energy-efficient than every other TV I looked at and generates very little heat after extended use, making it even more budget-friendly.- It takes 10+ seconds for it to turn on, during which it briefly displays an oversized TCL logo, but once powered up it is pretty responsive.- Unplugging the TV occasionally resets the picture settings while leaving all others intact - a mild inconvenience.- The power light in the bottom left corner is on when the TV is off and off when the TV is in on - very counter-intuitive.Bottom line:This TCL has its quirks, but it's quite a good HDTV, especially given the price range, and one I'd definitely buy again. If you're considering paying the premium for a more recognizable brand as I did, give this TCL a try first. If you don't like it, send it back - Amazon will even pay the return shipping! What do you have to lose?

Reviews.Title: Love the TV! Stand Assembly... not so much
Reviews.Author: A. Griggs
Reviews.Content: I will keep this short and sweet. I just got the TV and the picture is AH-MAZING! For the price it almost (note almost) like a name brand LED TV. The only issue I had was the stand assembly... oh dear that process was really something. The screws provided were too big (honestly, they look like either mounting screws or wood screws, eh... whatever), I did try to make sure they were straight before using a screwdriver, but no dice. So thankfully, I found some smaller spare screws around the house, and (check this random bit of hoarding out) some old Ikea washers that I neglected to use and that worked out. (Don't worry, that Ikea thing didn't need those washers anyway...)Despite having to think of MacGyver's "turn obsolete objects into deadly weapons of escape" background music in my head to find screws and washers around the house to fasten the stand on to the bottom of this TV, the 39-inch set is pretty freaking sweet!

Reviews.Title: It has a beautiful picture
Reviews.Author: LuisV
Reviews.Content: This unit has a production problem.In my case it will show faint blue lines and intermitent a lot of white lines.It's imposible to watch it.I also seen the same unit, in a larger screen model, in an store and it did have the same problem with the white lines but in this case the faint lines were green.Is too bad, because the picture is otherwise gorgeous, and for the price, it's a bargain.Amazon handled the return and refound in an excelent maner.Thank you Amazon.

Reviews.Title: My warranty experience
Reviews.Author: Kipling
Reviews.Content: I bought a TCL L40FHDF12TA model with 2-year warranty one and a half year ago. Frankly speaking, I doubted the warranty when I bought it due to the negative reviews on its warranty. However when my TV went wrong one month ago, I had to give it a try. It is true that you might need to call their number several time and wait for as long as 30 mins before you can talk to representatives. However their representatives are nice and helpful.I was instructed to ship my  TV to A&D; Electrical supply in California. If you have your original shipping package, then the shipping cost is on TCL. Otherwise you may need to pay $50 for shipping. Fortunately I still kept mine. Three weeks later, my TV was sent back to my home and its problem is gone. I am happy that I can watch TV again on Thanksgiving.Overall, I am satisfied with this purchase. Without the 2-year warranty, I might need to buy a new one.

Reviews.Title: Awesome LED TV!
Reviews.Author: Bobbydd21
Reviews.Content: Okay, so like many other people, I was a little weary about buying this TV as I had never heard of the brand before. However, it was defiantly worth it!Picture Quality: The picture quality is AWESOME. If you just take a little while to adjust the picture settings you can get this display to look just as good as any expensive TV. I use this with DirecTV, my PS3, and my MacBook Pro, and all of them look amazing, especially the stuff in BluRay and 1080P. The screen is bright and vibrant, has good contrast, and good color. A friend of mine recently bought a 2,000 dollar Samsung Smart TV, and besides the lack of Smart features in the TCL, I honestly can't tell much of a difference at all.Sound Quality: After reading several of the past reviews I was kind of worried about the sound quality, even though I have a surround sound system. However, I've been using the speakers on TV for the past few days and they really don't sound as nearly as bad as other people make them out to be. Again, my friends 2,000 Samsung LED does not have great sound either, which is expected from a thin TV. The bass, mids, and treble can all be adjusted in the EQ, even though you really can't get too much bass out of it. However, I did get it to sound better than the default settings. Again, just take some time to adjust the settings.Physical Setup & Appearance: To me, the TV looks great! It's very thin and the thin bezel is awesome. I have read a lot of reviews regarding the stand, and how is it hard to setup. I did not encounter this problem at all. It took me about 5 minutes, if that, to get the stand on. The screws require a little strength, but nothing compared to what other people exaggerated about it. Also, the stand is glass and is very sturdy. I was looking at a Sceptre TV as well, and there were many complaints I read about how the plastic stand was not sturdy. Trust me, if you put this stand on right, it's defiantly not going anywhere.Overall this a excellent TV, especially for the price. I recommend anyone pondering over whether to get it to just get it.

Reviews.Title: (PICTUREs/PROs/CONs)The Creative Life 39 inch LED TV, BUY IT!
Reviews.Author: gabe
Reviews.Content: On a budget but you want a new/secondary HDTV? This is it!BELIEVE the reviews that say this tv has "Beautiful" and AMAZING 1080p/visuals, because IT DOES!I have always bought name brands(Samsung/LG/Sony), but apparently this tv uses samsung screens or something of the sort. But what convinced me to buy this were the good reviews and a few pictures presenting the quality of visuals. Quality is GREAT.Looks just as good as my 32inch Samsung(if not better) and my buddy's 43inch LG. PROS:+Wonderful 1080p visual, like any big name brand.++Energy efficient($11/yr on some energy scale thing)+++Its 39 inches(diagonally) of awesomeness!++++Can plug in audio jack for speaker systems/headphones+++++HDMI, 2 ports as well as 1 USB portCons:-Only 2 HDMI ports, if you need more than two--Sound quality isn't all that great, I use a 2.1 speaker system w/bass(CYBER ACOUSTICS) to improve sound greatly, and it is great!---USB option not playing movies, not even reading my external harddrive----Remote(stock) may be slow to respond-----Limited visual/sound optionsPICTURES, will be posted later today, I am on my phone and can't post pics/videos.Also, I use this for my XBOX 360 and HD Cable. I followed another reviews tip on bringing down the sharpness to about 25-35 for better picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Excellent gaming monitor!
Reviews.Author: Allen E. Kaczor
Reviews.Content: I'm using this display with my PC and I love it. Not quiet a true 39" computer monitor but its not $4500 either. Its on my desktop an arms length away and theres no flicker or lag what so ever in the display. Running at 1920x1080x60hz. You can adjust native resolution through windows. Was not sure of the TCL brand but after a week of non stop use it puts my old 27" HP to shame. If you want a huge desktop display look no further and purchase a TCL. Its the best $348 PC accessory you'll ever buy. You won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: Looks Great - bought used and got what I paid for
Reviews.Author: Steven Hughes "ReturnZero"
Reviews.Content: I bought a used 43-incher, sold by Tradeport. It was only $275 plus about $40 shipping (no tax), which is a good amount below the new price. It was not in perfect shape, but it works fine and looks great. The only problem with it was one of the tabs of the top of the plastic frame was popped out, and the screen was warped slightly outward there. This caused a bright line (from the backlight bleeding through) to show up at that area along the top edge of the screen. All I did to fix it was remove a few screws from the plastic frame and pop the clip back into place. Now everything is perfect except for a little piece of dust that got down into the screen. I can only see it when I am less than a foot away, so no problem there. Otherwise, the thing is in new condition, with the plastic wrap still covering the glass base. Shipped faster than expected and came well-packaged in original box.As far as features go, this TV is pretty basic, but that's exactly what I was looking for. It looks really good for $300. The settings/remote are easy to navigate, and it plays well with external speakers and PC hookups. If you're messing with the picture, don't get "brightness" and "backlight" mixed up. If you turn the brightness down to about 40 and the backlight to 100, you get good blacks and nice bright colors. I had never heard of TCL before researching this one, and I don't know much about their customer service, but this TV is of solid quality, and I have no problem recommending it. I give it 5 stars despite the frame tab issue because I expected as much buying it used.--UPDATE--Concerning the customer service, I was pleasantly surprised. I had a question about hooking up my computer to the TV using an HDMI cable (wasn't displaying full screen). I submitted the question via their website, and I wasn't sure it would work, so I also called them. I got through on the phone quickly, they took my question, and said they would call me back within a day or so. The next day, I got a response to my email, as well as a call back about my question. They were extremely patient and helpful. I had given them my graphics card model and they figured out it was a problem with that, not with the TV. I adjusted my overscan on my computer as they suggested, and voila, a perfect image! They were basically helping me troubleshoot my graphics card, which has nothing to do with TCL. Impressive service.I have heard bad things about people who need physical service done (warranty work) and long delays in replacement parts and such. However, I suspect this has more to do with the authorized technicians then TCL itself, as well as the fact that this company is not quite as well-established as other brands like Samsung or LG. They seemed eager to help though, and I definitely will consider TCL for future purchases.--UPDATE--15 months later, still going strong with no issues. Glad I bought it!

Reviews.Title: ir stopped working after 40 days
Reviews.Author: BDBB
Reviews.Content: I like the tv.  I have had it for two mouths now.  The ir sensor on the front of the tv stopped working.  I have tried to diffrent remotes so I know the problem is in the tv itself.  So now I have to use the on/off button on the side of the tv.  Not such a good deal after all.

Reviews.Title: Not bad
Reviews.Author: CBR "Phil"
Reviews.Content: Since others have really tore into it, I'm not going to go into a lot of depth on this TV.The good points:It is inexpensive for a 43" LED TVPicture quality is good with HDMI cablesSmall profile, though bigger than the slim TVs.Not bad looking.Pretty light weight.Simple controls and remote.Easily recognized by universal remote.The not so good:Not very many hook ups for AV equipmentBase does not swivel.Controls only accessible through remote.Speakers are pretty bad.The sound is barely tolerable, but you can tweak it somewhat through the TVs equalizer to make it a bit less tinny.  Since a lot of people use external speakers, it may not be that much of an issue. For normal TV watching I managed to adjust the sound to the point where I can tolerate it without making me cringe (the wife thinks its fine.) I have a surround setup for movies and I *could* use that for the TV too, but it would be one more remote to use.The lack of inputs may not affect the many people either, but I have an older DVD player that doesn't hook to HDMI and this doesn't have S-video, plus I have older consoles systems that I hook up to it (SNES, Genesis, PS2 and they work fine with it).I hate it when new equipment makes me modernize my perfectly good old stuff!I give it 4 stars for the sound being pretty bad and lack of inputs, but after living with it for a couple months it seems to be a good purchase. I hope it lasts!Also, one problem that I have with LCD, plasma, LED TVs is the lack of screen protection. Some of the old glass CRTs had a protective piece of glass in front of the screen and they were far more resilient to impact than these new ones, and none of the modern TVs come standard with them. My other TV was permanently damaged by a pretty low impact to the screen (a marble thrown in the air and not at the screen). Not enough to break the glass behind, but enough to cause a vast amount of pixels to become stuck. So, I purchased a piece of clear plexi-glass, cut it to size and mounted it to the frame with velcro to protect against any accidental impacts. I highly recommend something similar to those who have kids.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Y. Meng
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV based on the rave reviews from Amazon. However, I am very disappointed over the quality of the product. First, 3 of the 4 screws for the stand did not fit. I tried manual and power tools, and finally gave up. Now the TV is connected on the stand on one screw. Second, the color seems very washed out and greyish. The black is not dark black, but greyish black. Not sure I got a lemon or not, this TV lacks the vivid color that my other TVs (one Sony LCD and one LG plasma) are producing.The TV is going back to Amazon even though I got a fantastic deal during holiday promotions. I would rather spend a little more to buy something that I can truly enjoy.

Reviews.Title: great value, works fine
Reviews.Author: gjc
Reviews.Content: I was a little wary of buying this TV in the first place because of some of the negative reviews regarding its picture and sound quality.  However, I put in the order and crossed my fingers and I actually ended up with one that seems (so far) to be perfectly fine in terms of display and speakers.I saw some reviews that said they disliked the speakers on the TV, but honestly I can turn it sound to a level where I feel like it gets too loud.  It's not sheer loudness either because I've listened to some of the in game music on my headphones on another display and these TV speakers seem to play it at a respectable quality (obviously not as good as headphones).The picture quality is quite nice as well in comparison to the past display and TV I've used to play the same Xbox games.  I don't see any pixelation or any other kinds of blurriness/marks of a bad display and all-in-all, I seriously have no qualms.I had a little trouble assembling the base at first because I was trying to use a hand screwdriver for some reason but once I realized what I was doing and switched to the electric screwdriver, I had no problems.Maybe theres an issue with quality control and not all TVs they ship out are the same, but the one I received was spot on an awesome value.

Reviews.Title: Great bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: bps1977
Reviews.Content: PROS:-Very good picture quality, not perfect but close-Light weight-If you use the included base, it is made with nice glass-Low Price-Sleek designCONS:-Not enough inputs, 1 more HDMI and or component as well as 1 more composite connection should have been included.-So so sound, but its to be expected with the thin frame, however, it is still sufficient and does not hinder enjoyment-When changing inputs, if you go too slow the USB input stalls searching for something connected, annoying especially when using my Harmony remoteFor this price and warranty, you can not go wrong!I actually received it overnight with free shipping!

Reviews.Title: As advertised
Reviews.Author: Larry M. Paroubek
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product as a replacement for a failing Samsung, and am more than satisfied at its performance.It was easy to set-up, though the heavy glass base-plate was awkward to attach. As mentioned in several reviews, default sound was not-so-good, being a bit tinny and/or "hollow" sounding. Fortunately, audio set-up adjustments made the sound much more life-like..."Warm-up" takes a bit longer than other televisions I've owned -- about twice as long as average.Overall -- a good value for the price...

Reviews.Title: Great price for great TV!!
Reviews.Author: Zin Armagadan
Reviews.Content: I was pretty stunned to see the quality picture this television had to offer. I had some minor troubles, but they were easily fixed.First off, I had a hell of a time getting the stand on it till I realized the screws were self grooving screws and I needed to screw them directly into the plastic slots without the glass stand first. Also, I had my Playstation 3 plugged into HDMI 1 and not even 20 minutes, the picture when using the PS3 would go to grey static with no sound. I realized I saw it say "HDMI/DVI" next to the slot and tried my DVI to HDMI cable I bought ages ago for my computer and moved my PS3 to HDMI 2 and voila, no problems ever since!So here are a couple things to consider when purchasing:1) Screw the screws into the slots without the stand first to create the grooves, then unscrew them and apply the glass stand.2) If you have problems with a device via HDMI going to a quiet grey static screen, switch to the other HDMI port and use the top one for a computer or other device that wont fuzz out.Other than my couple of problems, I've really been enjoying my new 39" TV. I'm using it to write this review right now!!

Reviews.Title: The Camry of TVs: elegant in simplicity
Reviews.Author: J. Gillon
Reviews.Content: I own three TCL TVs (two 43s and a 39) and couldn't be more pleased. Great picture and good sound at a very competitive price. There aren't many bells and whistles, but that's less to break or fail. The Camry of TVs.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the price.
Reviews.Author: Kolya
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints with this TV.  Quality picture, okay audio (about as good as can be expected on a thin LED TV), looks more expensive than it is.  Its not going to beat a Sony or a Samsung, but you get almost as much functionality for substantially less dough.

Reviews.Title: A lot better than I expected. Pleased with the picture quality. Sound is below average.
Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is really good. It's comparable to Vizio and Samsung monitors after proper ISF Calibrations. The picture isn't as good as a OLED but for the price, you won't be disappointed at all. I mainly use this TV for video games and extending my monitor. It's does the job well for both. If you need a lot of features/function from your TV such as Audio-out for your Coaxial and Optical ports, 4x HDMI ports, 4x Component ports, and built-in functions like picture-in-picture or program guides: do not buy this TV. This TV comes with the bare essentials and you should treat it as much when deciding. Thankfully there's a built-in digital antenna so picking up digital channels is possible.The speaker quality is below average. You can tolerate it but it sounds like the speakers are coming out of a pipe rather than naturally coming from the TV itself. The TV comes with headphone jack-in: What I did was disable the TV speakers and connected my Logitech Z5500 to the TV. TV speakers should only be a deciding factor for you if you intended to use them primarily. If you have a nice audio-receiver: disregard this part.Overall: This TV is marketed for those that simply want the great picture without the unnecessary add-ons and plugs that one may never use. I use it for gaming and PC desktop work and that's all. It serves my purposes and even gives a bit bang for buck cause of the great picture. The picture is very comparable to my Samsung Plasma. Not spot on, but the rumors of TCL using Samsung-like screens doesn't seem as far fetched.If you live in California: TCL contracts a repair center in San Francisco should you need to service the TV. Mines has been running strong for the past 5 months.

Reviews.Title: Nice price - 2 year warranty!
Reviews.Author: Tman "Biz/Mgt. Teacher-Facilitator"
Reviews.Content: The picture has been great, even in daylight.  Controls are simple.  My wife loves the thin bezel. Takes a couple moments to boot-up, but not bad. Have had two months now, with no issues.  Mounted easily on the wall.  The depth is a few inches, so it is not perfectly flat on the wall, but we are quite satisfied.  The on-board speakers are not bad either, and will certainly do for when you don't want to fire up big speakers.  I find the menu very easy to use.  For a simple, no frills TV, this is hard to beat for a little over $400.

Reviews.Title: TCL = AWESOMENESS
Reviews.Author: MaybNexTime
Reviews.Content: First time buying tv and I couldn't be happier. Who needs a $800-1000 Tv when you can just grab this one. Before I bought this tv, I was unsure because of the brand, but once i got it, the tv was in perfect condition and is perfect for gaming. Blu - ray looks surperb and the TV itself was pretty easy to set up. Another thing is if your using the TV stand make sure you use a Drill because i didn't know if you had use one, screw the 4 screws hand tight then use the drill to get it in there. But anyways for the Price its going for, the picture looks awesome. Only suck thing is 2 hdmi outputs, which i only use 2 anyways, for my ps3 and computer. Also Sound is terrible, but you can just buy a cheap computer speaker and then you will be set. If you looking for a TV then this is the one to grab. Don't forget keep the box ( just in case you want to send back TV or their is problems with it). Oh and im not sure if this is true but before I bought this tv I read that it has Samsung panel or parts in it.

Reviews.Title: Buy It! You'll Be Happy With It!!
Reviews.Author: ParticularPurchaser
Reviews.Content: The average consumer and even those on the picky side will be thrilled with this TV. If you are a videophile or a want-a-be one, then you have no business looking at Brand X TV's like this one or anything in this size at this price range. I have the 43" model in my bedroom. The picture is a good as the Samsung LED in my Den that retailed for $1999.00 three years ago. The TCL is sleek, stylish and has great picture quality. Forget about the nay sayers claims and buy it. You'll be very happy you did!

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly nice for the price
Reviews.Author: digiwealth
Reviews.Content: I have to say I am pretty impressed with this tv. Part of what my company does is install and operate led digital signs in high traffic areas. Like hotel lobby's, ice arenas, Dr's offices, places like that. We are always buying led tv's to use as our screens. I've used Phillips, RCA, Toshiba, but my usually I prefer Samsung. I got this because of the smaller bezel. I also heard that the display/screen is made by the same company where Samsung gets theirs. Regardless if it is true or not, the proof is in the pudding and I have been pleasantly pleased. Picture quality is good. My drawback is the size, primary width, of the tv. The speakers stick out a little bit in the back. Not a huge deal I guess, but just don't think it is completely slim. I will try to put up a side view pic of it so you can see.Real nice tv and the price is great. I can't speak to the durability, but its been 2 months in a location where it is running and on 24 hours a day.I'm gonna try another one the next time I need something for my house.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal for the Money
Reviews.Author: Tim204
Reviews.Content: Though I was a little skeptical at first with considering an off-brand, I am not disappointed in this TCL. This TV far exceeded my expectations for what a $349 TV should be.  Topping it off was free shipping and a 2 year warranty.  How can you do any better than that?  If you are in the market for an inexpensive but very nice TV, consider the TCL as a viable option.

Reviews.Title: Picture died after less than 2 months...good luck with repairs
Reviews.Author: IslesFan76
Reviews.Content: Needed a nice flatscreen at a reasonable price.  Did my research and thought I had found a bargain with TCL.  Big mistake.  The picture quality is pretty good and sound was ok.  But after less than 2 months of use the picture just went out.  Called BJs, where i bought the TV, but they wouldn't take it back because after 2 months I had gotten rid of the box.  TCL is a Chinese company with what seems to be a lack of focus on customer service.  I called their phone number many different times.  Finally got through to a person who mailed me some replacement pieces for free.  They said there is a known problem with some of the chips overheating.  Once I received the parts I was told to then call for a repair person to come to my house.  That was several weeks ago and haven't been able to get through to anyone at TCL since then.  I guess you get what you pay for.  If I had to do it over again I'd spend an extra $150 bucks for a decent brand like Samsung or Toshiba.  The irony is, in my research it said TCL screens are supplied by Samsung.  Oh well.

Reviews.Title: Wow in a box, or not . . .
Reviews.Author: James W. Cornwell
Reviews.Content: Out of the box this set works great, I needed to make no adjustments to it, except when I swap between cable and Netflix from the Wii.  This things picture quality destroys my 37" widescreen 1080p Samsung, which admittedly is 7 years old.  At this time I have no regrets about buying this one, even considering getting one of the versions with Netflix built in for the bedroom at some point in the future.  I will be updating this if anything changes.  On a no name product, one only has reviews to go off of, so if longevity is a problem for the TV or I have any other problems I will update to make sure people have the best possible info to go off of.  Side note, if you already have a receiver close to your TV, there is a cable that you can get to run two channel (stereo) output out of the TV to run through your receiver so you can get better sound, because the sound is definitely a little tinny.  That is for those of us with dinosaurs for audio system (Dolby Digital and older)  If your receiver is a nice one and has HDMI audio AND video switching, (please make sure it does both, because HDMI carries both signals, that does not mean your audio equipment will output both signals) then you can run HDMI from your video devices through your receiver and then out of that to the TV . . . not sure if you can turn off the speakers on the TV yet though, give me a sec to check that while I am thinking of it . . .yes, the speaker can be turned off.  This TV does not have ALL of the bells and whistles, but it covers the basics fairly well from what I can tell.  The remote is a little counter-intuitive in comparison with many of the remotes that I have used in the past, but despite the odd layout, it is something that is learnable, and it is fairly clearly labeled.  At this time this is rated as a great buy for the value minded TV purchaser.Update 03/23/13:  Less then a month after receiving, this TV turned itself off, and would not turn back on.  Previous reviews lead me to believe that you either get a good one, or a bad one.  This is my hope, and that the next one will function well, for much longer then around two weeks.  Rating is losing one star, which it may earn back if then next one works as it should.  It may also lose stars if I continue to have problems.Update 03/??/13:  Apologize for the lateness in getting this in here.  Thought I already had.  Wow in a box it is not, or was not for me.  The replacement model got to us quite quickly, and it's picture was bad from the start.  Where as the first model gave us an outstanding picture from the beginning, this one the color faded in and out.  On Netflix for the Wii it has a screensaver that just shows darker then the regular.  Best description I can give for the problem with the second model, is the shade on the screensaver should stay the same, and it went dark and lighter, unevenly the entire time.  On a second model from an unknown, with a history that is not terribly impressive, I wasn't gonna take a chance at a third time.Final Comments:  If you like your luck, you have a chance at a fine TV, if the first model shows any bad behavior, when you go for a replacement, get the name brand if you can afford it.  With the good reviews on here, you could end up being satisfied, however I won't give it a try again.  And if you have it replaced with the same model, you won't have the option of trading up if the second one is a dud as well.  For myself, I won't try it again.

Reviews.Title: Bang for the buck!!!
Reviews.Author: Joehotels
Reviews.Content: I was perfectly happy with my CRT. Last week, my heart sank when it died - not due to any attachment to the TV, but owing to the fact that I never thought I would find one that fit in my enclosed cabinet.  After hours of searching an endless multitude of websites, Amazon came to the rescue with the TCL LE39.  My space is 24.5"x36" and the TCL came in at a hair over 23" by 35".  Four screws and the base was on. I attached it to my Uverse receiver, plugged it in, followed the quick set up instructions and done.  A couple of pushes of the picture button on the remote to pick a brighter than default picture and I was done."Is the picture amazing?" you ask. If you are a HD junkie then maybe not.  Compared to my CRT?  A real improvement. (I do use HDMI but do not have an HD package.)  I was looking to not spend $1000 on a stupid TV and to get decent results. This is EXACTLY what I was looking for.TCL LE39FHDF3300TA 39-Inches 1080p LED TV - Black

Reviews.Title: No problems so far
Reviews.Author: Peter S. Goldberger
Reviews.Content: Despite some reviews, I have had the TV for 3 weeks and have had absolutely no problems with it. The stand was a bit difficult to attach, but if that's the only problem, then I'll end up with a very good TV at a very good price.

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: Like many, I was skeptical of this low priced off brand TV.  I'm not a videophile, I just didn't have a TV and figured it was time to get one so I gave this a try.  I have been using it for 6 months now and have been pleasantly surprised.First, the negative.  I shouldn't have looked but since so many other reviews mentioned dead pixels my eyes couldn't help but go searching and sure enough, there it was.  A little dark speck that never seemed to go away, however it is only noticeable when you're right in front of the TV.  Move back about 5ft and even knowing exactly where it is I can't spot it.  Because of this, I decided it wasn't worth the hassle of returning the TV.  If you don't think about it I even forgot it was there for a few weeks.  As others have also mentioned the sound isn't great but it's certainly acceptable and on par with other thin TV's like this.  The USB input doesn't recognize any video files I've tried so I think its kind of pointless but it's there.I do feel the positives outweigh the negatives with this TV.  Despite the dead pixel, the picture is quite good.  Watching an HD movie from back on the couch is quite impressive and as I mentioned before, the dead pixel isn't noticeable.  It can be viewed from all angles and is even decently visible in direct sunlight.  I also use the HDMI to hook up to my laptop and the two link up flawlessly.  There's no lag with mouse movement or keystrokes at all.  The smart volume feature is basically just an audio compressor and for the most part works well to even out loud commercials.  The audio quality does suffer if listening through a good system and you can sometimes hear sounds that go above the compression threshold and get quickly brought back down, which can be annoying, but the feature can be turned off and it generally works ok.  It would be nice if it had RCA audio out jacks but adapters can be had to utilize the 1/8" jack.  The 1/8" jack is in a tight place that larger adapters won't fit in, so a skinny extension might be needed.I gave this 4 stars because of the pixel but considering the price that this thing goes for, I think it is still a good value for the occasional TV watcher or someone who wants a bigger computer screen.

Reviews.Title: So far so good!
Reviews.Author: Cmodman
Reviews.Content: Will update after 30 days, then 3 months then so on...5/7/13 - 5 STARS!After just a few days, I love this TV for the price and quality!Shipping / Packaging: Top notch, very secure packaging, no dents on box, no dents on product, everything accounted for, nothing missing, does not look like used product, arrived ahead of schedule, very pleased.Set up: Super easy, didn't even look at instructions. Attached the neck to the TV then to the stand (screws all fit by the way, not sure what some others were saying about it not fitting, maybe a bad batch or use the wrong screws??) then that was it. Attached all the components and boom, after a few color and image tweaking which by the way, the presets were all fairly set nicely, but I'm more meticulous to use presets.TV: first thing I did was play some PS3 and it looked pretty awesome. From the distance I am from this TV, it looks just as good as my 60" LED 1080p, not any better, but not far off from similar quality. Very smooth images, good refresh rate, no issues whatsoever. There are only 2 HDMI ports, which can be bummer for multiple components. I have my Apple mac mini to one HDMI and have to swap between the PS3 and XBOX for another HDMI. It has an audio port for headphones which is a nice feature, especially those with turtle beaches that need an audio out for wireless headphone. I had posted a pic of the set up in the images sectionSummary: overall, very impressed and pleased with this purchase. At only $200, it didn't break the bank, and it's a great addition to the house. Hopefully my feelings will remain after a month.

Reviews.Title: Excellent screen, no dealbreakers
Reviews.Author: andy17null
Reviews.Content: **HEADS UP**The top flap of the cardboard box is held shut with enormous copper staples. It looks like it would be really easy to scratch the screen on these staples as you unbox the TV, so be sure to discard the staples before lifting the TV out of the box!---Paid $329, which seems reasonable for this TV. Sure it's not top of the line but it blows my old 26" 720p TV (bought for $500 in 2007) right out of the water.Most importantly the Samsung-sourced screen looks fantastic, contrast ratio is excellent, factory settings use rather high Backlight power which you might want to turn down for better blacks. As other reviews have mentioned, adjust the Sharpness setting to taste. Remarkably slim bezel around the screen.Switching between inputs is nice and snappy.There is an 'Auto Volume Control' setting that appears to be a compressor; handy if you're watching videos that are way too loud during the loud bits and way too quiet during the quiet bits.The orange 'power off' LED does not distract me, it's dim, in daylight you could mistake it for a daub of orange paint.Audio quality from the 3.5" jack is fine; I am running it through Logitech LS21 speakers ( [...] ) which are great for the price.Some notes on the base plate:To attach the base plate you must lay the TV face down on a flat surface overhanging the edge and then attach the base plate with screws. As other reviewers have pointed out these are not high quality screws. You must use some force to screw them in; I could feel the threads biting into plastic, instead of threading into a nut. They look like wood screws, not machine screws. This seems like poor design; I worry that after a few assembly/disassembly cycles, the plastic will strip and the screws will stop holding the base on securely.However that's a minor quibble for me. The base is securely attached (for now); the TV is stable on the base; and I don't intend to transport it anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: Very Very Nice
Reviews.Author: Dnice1
Reviews.Content: For the price it's great, haven't had any trouble, picture is awesome. I don't use the TV's speakers, and they're not the greatest thing, but I didn't plan to use them anyway. I have some speakers connected to the TV. The remote could have had the keys light up, I hate having to either turn on a light, or try to use the light from the TV if a good scene comes on. Other than that, I love it, I didn't buy it for the remote or the speakers, those can be improved with other products.

Reviews.Title: BEST PRICE on THE WEB for 2yr LED!
Reviews.Author: ZechariahB
Reviews.Content: Customer found the color and extra brightness to be such a problem we returned one to prove it was normal operation.I chose this over many others due to low cost for what a customer needed.  I have been reviewing and installing TVs for about 15 years and for the price and everything in a package deal this is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Awesome for the price
Reviews.Author: Aaron "Red"
Reviews.Content: I got this during the holidays last year for a living room tv and its a good size and awesome picture when you tweak all the settings to your likening... It's only cheaper than others cause it doesn't have apps or anything extra... But if our have a game system your set there for Netflix or Vudo... Just a simple tv with an amazing picture at a good price... Simply worth it...

Reviews.Title: great picture and design
Reviews.Author: jet dragon
Reviews.Content: i have this tv for a month now.  this tv looks good when turned off due to its very slim benzel. it's direct lit LED, better than many edge lit TVs out there. black level is very good. color and clarity are amazing. will buy TCL again.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: T. Maughan "Computer Professional"
Reviews.Content: Pro:  Sharp and bright.  Very pleased with image quality and the price.Con:  Only 2 HDMI ports - however, so far I haven't needed more but would like to have a 3rd.  An HDMI port switcher is another low cost option.I would highly recommend this unit for its good value.  It is not rich in extra features but I don't need much more than a good display.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!!!!
Reviews.Author: Frank D Stewart
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv for my 85 year old mother.  She loves to watch Big 10 basketball and was used to watching a 25" console.  What an improvement!!!!  She can actually see faces and the score at the bottom of the page now!  She was dead set against this until we got it hooked up for her.  Now we can' t get her away from it.  She just has SD cable tv now but the picture is still very good.  I guess we will get her a HD cable box later, but one thing at a time!This is the second TCL tv I have purchased (the other being a 32" 720P).  Have had it over a year now and love it.

Reviews.Title: Good off-brand TV
Reviews.Author: 72cutty
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the money. I went from a 32" to 42" and the small bezel made a nice upgrade. As stated in some reviews, the settings take a little to get right. After you adjust the picture the settings sometimes don't want save if you don't hit the "go back" button on the remote. There is a short delay after the TCL brand screen comes on before the unit recognizes the input. Also it seems like after a week or so the screen breaks in and looks how it should in color and sharpness. Overall good TV if you don't want a smart unit. Xbox 360 with an HDMI cable looks great too.

Reviews.Title: Okay as a TV but not as a PC monitor
Reviews.Author: F. Feldman "Fred the IT guy"
Reviews.Content: Bought to use as a large monitor on a PC. Unit would not display color / resolution correctly.  TCL offered no tech support on this feature.  The picture was fine in TV mode, but not acceptable when being used as a PC monitor.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Deal
Reviews.Author: a. theis
Reviews.Content: Wonderful TV for a GREAT price!  The images are crystal clear.  Great shipping.  Easy to set up.  Nice size for my living room.

Reviews.Title: A good basic Television
Reviews.Author: Stephen MarcAurele
Reviews.Content: I'm not an expert on LCD panels, but I'm more than happy with my TCL.  Great picture, great price, ok sound.  Good out of the box experience.  Everything worked as expected and was easy to set up.  Watching TV in about 15 minutes.  The set doesn't have any built in network goodies, but I was not looking for all that.  My concern is long term dependability, and only time will address that.  All I can say for now is so far so good.

Reviews.Title: Very nice picture quality...
Reviews.Author: K. Santos "Wife, mommy, bookaholic, blogger"
Reviews.Content: My husband and I surprised my parents with this HDTV for Christmas. They had an older tv and it was much smaller. This has completely changed the look of the entire den. I like how there isn't a large frame around the screen, it gives it a very clean look. Amazon has the free shipping and no tax which is a huge plus and saved us quite a bit, not to mention we got a gret deal during the holidays.

Reviews.Title: Great so far
Reviews.Author: Robert E. Whaley
Reviews.Content: I've bought 4 of these TCL LED flat screens now and all but one have been great.  Actually all are great but the 55" one I bought has begun acting up only 2 months after purchase.  I'm sure warranty will resolve the issue.

Reviews.Title: High end TV without 3D or Internet
Reviews.Author: Eric Lewis "Computer Scientist"
Reviews.Content: I have an HTPC in my entertainment center so a smart TV is not needed.  This TV was the largest screen LCD that would fit into my 40" cabinet and it has room to spare.Picture quality is excellent.  I find the angle of view to be exceptional.  I was working on the TV in the cabinet looking down at the screen virtually standing above the TV and I could make out the image just fine.  Some reviews were negative about angle of view so this may be a subjective measure or a factor that varies within the sample.  Mine is great.I use the SPDIF Coax audio out to my Yamaha receiver,  two Bose 901s and Bose rear/center speakers.  There are a lot of surround sound effects in an NFL football broadcast that would otherwise go unnoticed.  This is a flawless implementation of digital audio, as far as I can determine.  I use the over the air antenna rf signal input as well as HDMI from the HTPC and a Blu-ray player.I like the glass stand but, because this is in a cabinet, it keeps the screen from being flush with the cabinet front.  So I've switched to the 200mm wall mount plate using an 18.5" fixed extender from the rear of the cabinet (room wall).  This cabinet formerly housed a Sony 34" 200 lb. flat screen HDTV (i.e. huge box).

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: C. C. PERRY "The Reverend"
Reviews.Content: bought it for my son's room, great TV, great picture, the kid loves it. PS3 games look great as do DVDs. Will be buying a TCL for the living room.

Reviews.Title: Best value in TV's
Reviews.Author: ba-da-bing!
Reviews.Content: How can you beat this? Price and performance incomparible for the money, even at close to twice the cost!VERY good build quality. Picture superb. Sound not world-class, but just fine!

Reviews.Title: Nice TV. Love the thin bezel. Speakers not so much.
Reviews.Author: Curt Lotter
Reviews.Content: I gave it a four star rating only because of the sound. Understandably, front facing speakers are not possible given the extremely thin bezel surrounding the screen, but the bottom facing speakers are still quite poor sounding. At first I thought I could simply hook up a pair of external speakers, but that's not the case. The TV doesn't have external speaker output jacks. I did have a small amp laying around and a pair of small speakers that I built, so I was able to use the headphone output to drive the amplifier, and finally, the sound was in the same league as the picture.This TV still makes a very good purchase for my wife. It's replacing an old 32" tube SD TV. She can live with the sound. By the way, the TV does have an equalizer built in, so it is possible to fake a little bit of upper bass.All in all, the picture looks great, and it's a really nice looking TV. I almost purchased two 32" TCL TVs last year for Christmas presents for my boys, but I couldn't quite get past the somewhat "no name" brand. I ended up purchasing LG TVs which are working great, but I probably would have been just as well off getting the TCL's and would have been money ahead.I heartily recommend this TV for anyone looking for something in this size range. If it's to be hooked up to a home theater receiver or sound system, to get past the built in speakers, all the better.

Reviews.Title: Surprise Excelence
Reviews.Author: Bryand
Reviews.Content: By far one of the best buys I've made this year.  I bought this because of the price, but I was amazed by the image quality.  Customer Service was excellent also.  Though call waits were long, They easily helped me with my questions.  What surprised me was how well this fit in my entertainment center that would normally fit a 37"-40" HDTV.  The Bezel is so thin that it makes it fit perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: volodoscope "Artist by heart, geek by nature"
Reviews.Content: I've never heard of TCL brand so had no idea what I was getting and I was very surprised of how good it is. I got it very quickly and it arrived packaged pretty well. Took 5 minutes to set up. It's pretty light, so would hang on the wall perfectly. I really liked the glass bottom stand. Also, surprised it was actual glass. It looks very nice and doesn't make the TV look cheap. Picture quality is very nice. It's not as color balanced as some expensive brands but there are manual settings where you can adjust any of those things. I love the thin bezel around the screen. It's one of the thinnest ones's I've seen for this size and price. The only thing I didn't like is that my Comcast remote couldn't find the code to program the controls, still searching for it online; and when in total dark room when the Light Sensor is on with Active Backlight the screen changes the brightness in pretty dramatic/noticeable increments. Not smoothly like some other brands.Overall, this is a no-brainer to buy! Great price, great quality, 1080looks awesome hooked up to my Apple tv.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for Price
Reviews.Author: Richard Guzzo
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the price, it is what it is... The picture is solid, doesn't battle glare very well. Sound is bad, but I got external speakers hooked up, sounds great.

Reviews.Title: Great value for 39" TV
Reviews.Author: starstruck
Reviews.Content: I am happy with the picture on this TV, especially when I consider the price....it's amazing. The picture is sharp and bright with good color. The sound is it's only weakness but it's not bad and I think part of the problem with the sound is because of the speakers not facing out the front...but that's what I like about it's appearance. With the very narrow border around the screen you see basically nothing but the TV screen! This is also what made it possible to fit a 39" TV into the opening in the entertainment center that was probably designed for a 32"! And fortunately Amazon's measurements were very precise and accurate so it just fit. If I want to improve the sound I can always run it through a home theater system but I don't really think that's necessary. I've only had it a few days but so far I am very pleased and would highly recommend this TV to anyone trying to maximize screen size in a limited size space. When trying to find just the right TV I was very impressed with the vast choices offered by the TCL brand.

Reviews.Title: Picture good, sound not so much.
Reviews.Author: Emanuel
Reviews.Content: The picture of the panel is pretty good with lively colors. Unfortunately, the speakers built into the TV are not of the same quality. Furthermore, the HDMI inputs to not support CEC. Thus, it is not possible to operate devices that are connected to the TV via HDMI with the TV's remote. All in all, it is a pretty good bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful image ane list of features
Reviews.Author: JK "A soccer dad and ref"
Reviews.Content: We love the image and features on this HDTV.  It is working great in essentially every manner we expect.  While it does have limited video inputs, it has enough for our needs (we basically use it to watch TV and DVD/BlueRay movies, not for gaming or online movie purchases) works well for our expectations.  The sound is reasonable, but not great. However, if you want better sound, buy a sound system to go with the TV. The only negative with this monitor was that it took a little effort to get our DISH TV remote to work with it.  TCL is not one of the standard options and the remote was not able to autosync with the TV. I read online that RCA codes work and I had some luck with those, but the best option was to call DISH and get their assistance.  The DISH remote now manages most of the features of the TV remote, but not all of them including adjusting many of the TV settings and using the Sleep function.  Bottom line, the image on this TV is wonderful for the price and the sound is decent.  It works fine for basic TV, but will probably not be ideal for someone with lots of accessories that need separate inputs. I can't comment on its ability as a gaming TV.

Reviews.Title: tcl tv
Reviews.Author: Alan Pennock "justme"
Reviews.Content: I like this TV. The only drawback is that it has no video output for recording, but I knew that before I bought it. The thin bezel was a clear deciding point. It means more viewing area in less space. Who wants to see the bezel?? And of course the picture is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Incredible display for an incredible price
Reviews.Author: Kevin Wang
Reviews.Content: This is a great display for the price.  The color and detail is pretty satisfactory and it has really everything I need.  You won't find a screen of this size and quality for this price anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: Very Good
Reviews.Author: Jawan
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this TV. I looked at all reviews and decided to buy this TV based on reviews and price.The picture quality is superb and I did not have any problem screwing the glass base to the TV as others havecomplained. I am not sure about the 2 year warranty and how good the fix will be if I run into some problem.If this TV works min 2 years without trouble, I will call it an excellent buy. The sound did not disappoint meas I did not expect much. I am hooking upto outside speakers.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value
Reviews.Author: Peter V. Owens
Reviews.Content: Very sharp picture and plenty of accessory connections.Sound is not great so I purchased Logitech S220 2.1 Speaker System with Subwoofer, and sound is fine now.My only complaint is that the loud-sound suppression option to dampen volume on ads kicks in after virtually every pause during regular programming and then dampens just about everything. Very annoying, so I turned the feature off. Too bad.Excellent value and quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: A great walue for the money!
Reviews.Author: Ward's Garage
Reviews.Content: The TV arrived on time and in perfect shape. It was very easy to setup and the picture quality is fantastic. The sound is a little weak but good enough for the price! A great value.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Vinny
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the money.  The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because the sound quality is buzzy and the side viewing is not very good once you get pass the front sweet spot.  Otherwise, the picture is excellent and the set-up easy; however, be careful when attaching the base as the screws seem to be too big but eventually go in with firm, steady hand.  Energy star rated is a nice thing to have (tv taking 10 seconds to come on is probably one reason for the high rating--does not have instant on).  Have set it up in front of the couch in a medium-sized living room and it is enjoyable to watch.  I had a 32" LED Element with excellent picture and sound but it died just short of 2 years old.  Element is junk because they do not stand behind their products or carry spare parts that you can order.  Hope the 39" TCL stands behind their tv's--at least they give you a 2 year warranty!

Reviews.Title: Seems to be an Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: This tv is easy to set up and use. The stand is easy to assemble and mount to the black glass base. It is reasonably sturdy, but does not swivel since the tv is light enough to move around. It comes with a quick start guide and a printed full version user's guide.The set takes about 15 seconds to turn on. I have it connected to an outdoor antenna and find that the LED screen gives amazing depth, color, clarity and sharp detail in HD. My tv arrived without any dead pixels.It has a nice piano black remote control which I think has decent buttons, feel, and design. The on screen menu is easy to navigate and use.Like all thin screen tvs the sound can leave something to desire. It has plenty of volume but not much bass. I would describe it as "thin" sounding rather than tinny. The tone quality improved when I set the sound equalizer to "voice" and now it sounds okay enough that I don't think a sound bar is necessary. The tv sits in the corner of our living room and can be easily heard throughout the room.As far as I know this is the only brand to have a 2-year warranty which is twice as long as other brands offer.
